be measured and converted into some coordinates interestingly enough it can detect multiple fingers at the same time
it's made popular by the iPhone in 2007 and it's very well known there are a
couple reasons why it's not very good for drawing though so most obviously it
usually requires a blunt object on the screen so you can't write precisely there's actually an exception to this
you can get some battery-powered styluses I actually have a much finer tip but I'll get into by those also
don't work very well it another problem you have is confusing the palm of the screen and then it has a relatively long
measurement time the amount of time it takes to actually figure out the position of something is actually too
long in contrast there's another piece of
technology the inductive stylus which is really quite fantastic for writing and
I'm seeing some people nodding their heads here which is it is great to hear because I've actually learned that most
people still are not familiar with this technology but I'd like to tell a little bit about how this works so what happens
is you need a special board behind the screen that emits the localized electromagnetic wave and then you have a
special stylus that with a circuit tuned to that wave that will reflect it back if it's at the right frequency and so
then the so the board emits a localized wave and then it switches to try to
detect the reflection and that will allow the board to figure out the proximity of the stylus so this is used
in only a few well-known tablets so the Microsoft Surface pro the Apple iPad pro
with the Apple pencil that's what that that's all about and then I have a Samsung device here that has an S Pen so
the S Pen also uses that technology and as I will now show you this is a lot
better for writing detailed expressions but I would like to actually go over the
patent a little bit more this is a patent by Wacom just explaining how it works again so here they have an array
of coils going from left to right the the hot the the height in this diagram
is actually the the full height of the screen and then they're about say 40 or so coils going from left to right along
the screen they're overlapping and each individual coil you can select one send
an alternating current through it that will emit the electromagnetic wave then you stop sending the alternate you stop
sending the current and then that same coil can function as a detector and then if the stylus is nearby it reflects it
back something that I think is quite remarkable about this idea is you can
have these you you can have a non-trivial circuit inside the stylus
and that allows you to say press a button on the side of the stylus or detect the that the the stylus is pressing on the
screen so even without having any battery in the stylus you can have this this functional input okay so going over
the measurement and response so in this figure here we have some clock signal a
and then B is a signal that determines whether we're emitting or detecting a
response so you say take a and B and
then you get C D would be the resonance in the stylus itself so as you're
sending the signal then the stylus becomes more resonant and then as you stop sending the signal then the the
stylus will will emit less back and then e is measured response from the stylus
and then from there is basically processing signal E but E is basically
what you're trying to measure and that will give you an idea the proximity of the stylus to the board or to the individual coil and then you do this for
a bunch of different coils so you repeat it a bunch of times and then you can
plot the response over all the coils and then do some statistics on that and you
can determine approximately where the the stylus is looking actually I shouldn't say approximately it's it's
incredibly precise and in this patent they they say that it can take them
about 10 milliseconds and that is fast enough to make a pretty precise to
precisely measure where the stylus has been okay so just to make things a

top of the screen for the inductive stylists you have the measuring device located behind the screen okay so some
drawbacks to the stylus or to this inductive stylus technology is that well you have to have a special stylus and
you have to have a special detecting board which must be placed underneath the screen in the tablet and this I
